picks.text: The next version of iOS brings changes to notifications
picks.full-pick-text: The next version of iOS brings changes to notifications

picks.text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
picks.full-pick-text: Third party widgets gain interactivity
picks.notes: • Edited to clarify "third party" as a few Apple widgets are already interactive.

picks.text: No Apple-made headset is seen
picks.full-pick-text: No Apple-made headset is seen
picks.notes: • Was originally "AR/VR/MR hardware" and "introduced", but the others wanted some clarifications.

picks.text: The next version of macOS will have at least one feature exclusive to Apple Silicon Macs
picks.full-pick-text: The next version of macOS will have at least one feature exclusive to Apple Silicon Macs
picks.notes: • There are a few examples: live captions in FaceTime, using an iPad Pro as a color reference display, and dictating emoji.

picks.text: iPadOS is updated to include a more desktop-like mode with resizable and overlapping windows
picks.full-pick-text: iPadOS is updated to include a more desktop-like mode with resizable and overlapping windows
picks.notes: • Was originally a Risky pick with the addition of a "with keyboard and trackpad" clause, but some WebKit source code changes made it much less risky. He watered it down further by removing an "overlapping" clause as well and not phrasing it as a "desktop-like mode", but then decided to just go all the way back to the original pick.

picks.text: New features for Tapback in Messages
picks.full-pick-text: New features for Tapback in Messages
picks.notes:
• Ungraded: more options than just the 5 built in, maybe even arbitrary emoji, better notification controls
  • It wasn't mentioned in the keynote, but yes, Tapback finally works properly for SMS.

picks.text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once
picks.full-pick-text: iOS gets split-view support for multitasking to use 2 apps at once
picks.notes:
• Ungraded: works in both portrait and landscape, drag and drop between apps.
  • That's iOS, as in on the iPhone.

picks.text: The new version of macOS brings back Dashboard as a way to place widgets outside of the current Notification Center
picks.full-pick-text: The new version of macOS brings back Dashboard as a way to place widgets outside of the current Notification Center
picks.notes: • It has to be called "Dashboard" to get the points.

picks.text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro...
picks.full-pick-text: Apple gives a sneak peak of the new Mac Pro. It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year.
picks.notes:
• "...It features a case design inspired by the 2019 Mac Pro. It features more ports than any other Apple Silicon Mac available today. It does not have support for third-party GPUs. It features a chip name that has not appeared in any other product. It has a starting price of at least $6,999. It is coming later this year."
  • Originally it said "same case design", but the change was accepted on air after Myke reconsidered. "Later this year" was also demoted from being an exact quote.
  • This Mac Pro will have to beat the Mac Studio in terms of ports: 2 USB-C, 2 USB-A, 4 Thunderbolt, SD card, Ethernet, HDMI, and headphone jack, for a total of 12.
  • This pick is similar in spirit to Myke's ongoing Annual pick, but with different conditions. At the time it was the most complex graded pick ever made.

picks.text: A presenter references the fact that some developers are at Apple Park for the keynote
picks.full-pick-text: A presenter references the fact that some developers are at Apple Park for the keynote
picks.notes: • This is litigated a bit later when Myke's very similar pick got graded, as Tim Cook did address the audience before the video played. He was decided to not be "a presenter" at the time, ultimately.

picks.text: AR-specific features are added to Swift or SwiftUI
picks.full-pick-text: AR-specific features are added to Swift or SwiftUI
picks.notes: • Nothing in the keynote, but ARKit 6 is adding RoomPlan, a new Swift API for scanning a room with a camera and LiDAR scanner.

picks.text: At least one iOS system app is redesigned to bring its controls to the bottom of the screen
picks.full-pick-text: At least one iOS system app is redesigned to bring its controls to the bottom of the screen
picks.notes: • Initially, the other two rejected Stephen's argument that the lock screen counted for this. However, later on while grading another controversial pick, Steve Troughton-Smith came to Stephen's aid live and helped bolster the case that the lock screen is in fact an app.

picks.text: Apple's classical music service is announced
picks.full-pick-text: Apple's classical music service is announced

picks.text: macOS 13 is called "Mammoth"
picks.full-pick-text: macOS 13 is called "Mammoth"

picks.text: Apple announces the first M2 Mac
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces the first M2 Mac

picks.text: Tim presents some portion of the keynote in front of a live audience
picks.full-pick-text: Tim presents some portion of the keynote in front of a live audience
picks.notes: • This is very very similar to Stephen's Flexie and both ultimately got graded at this point, as well as Stephen's other controversial pick.

picks.text: Widgets on tvOS
picks.full-pick-text: Widgets on tvOS
picks.notes: • As discussed by Myke on the AppStories podcast.

picks.text: More apps can use a picture-in-picture-style window on iPadOS
picks.full-pick-text: More apps can use a picture-in-picture-style window on iPadOS

picks.text: Redesign of the Home app... again
picks.full-pick-text: Redesign of the Home app... again
picks.notes: • A pick from last year gets (legally) reused.

picks.text: There is no additional external display support for iPadOS
picks.full-pick-text: There is no additional external display support for iPadOS

picks.text: iPadOS multitasking remains fundamentally the same as the iPadOS 15 version
picks.full-pick-text: iPadOS multitasking remains fundamentally the same as the iPadOS 15 version

picks.text: Big improvements to SwiftUI
picks.full-pick-text: Big improvements to SwiftUI

picks.text: Shortcuts gets an API on iOS and iPadOS for apps to run Shortcuts directly, without URL schemes
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts gets an API on iOS and iPadOS for apps to run Shortcuts directly, without URL schemes

picks.text: Shortcuts for Mac gets personal automations
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts for Mac gets personal automations

picks.text: You will be able to set light and dark mode on a per-website basis in Safari
picks.full-pick-text: You will be able to set light and dark mode on a per-website basis in Safari

picks.text: Apple brings Quick Note's floating window to iOS
picks.full-pick-text: Apple brings Quick Note's floating window to iOS

picks.text: The Music app gets an updated design in the Listen Now page
picks.full-pick-text: The Music app gets an updated design in the Listen Now page
picks.notes: • Federico still isn't happy with it, it seems.

picks.text: iPadOS gets improved split view with at least 3 apps at once
picks.full-pick-text: iPadOS gets improved split view with at least 3 apps at once

picks.text: Apple releases a Safari API to deal with cookie consent forms
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a Safari API to deal with cookie consent forms

picks.text: You can delete Messages in the Messages app, like in WhatsApp
picks.full-pick-text: You can delete Messages in the Messages app, like in WhatsApp
picks.notes: • That is, the ability to revoke a sent message so that the recipient can no longer read it.

picks.text: Apple introduces a proper Reminders API for developers
picks.full-pick-text: Apple introduces a proper Reminders API for developers

picks.text: Shortcuts gets an XL widget on iPad
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts gets an XL widget on iPad
